DataElement.preferredName: Neuro-QOL Item Bank v2.0 Adult Mental Health Cognitive Function NQCOG40r1 How Much Difficulty Currently Have Learning New Tasks or Instructions Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how much difficulty they currently have learning new tasks or instructions, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neuro-QoL Adult Self-Reported Mental Health Domain Neuro QoL Cognitive Function Subdomain Past Week Quantity Current Difficulty Learning New Tasks or Instructions Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain of the Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders that assesses the status of an adult individual's mental health._The collection of Neuro-QoL item scales that assess perceived difficulties in cognitive abilities related to both executive function and general concerns._The most recent week, including today._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A question about how much difficulty an individual currently has learning new tasks or instructions._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Neuro-QoL Adult Self-Reported Mental Health Domain
Concepts.definition: A domain of the Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders that assesses the status of an adult individual's mental health.
The collection of Neuro-QoL item scales that assess perceived difficulties in cognitive abilities related to both executive function and general concerns.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Quantity Current Difficulty Learning New Tasks or Instructions Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:A question about how much difficulty an individual currently has learning new tasks or instructions.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

Concepts.longName: Current Difficulty Learning New Tasks or Instructions
Concepts.definition: A question about how much difficulty an individual currently has learning new tasks or instructions.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A set of self-reported and proxy-reported measures of physical, mental, and social health for adults and children living with a neurological condition._An ordered reference standard used with the Neuro-QoL item bank that describes a reverse range of subjective scores for representing how much an individual experiences something from 5: None, to 2: A lot and including 1: Cannot do.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual cannot do something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual cannot do something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A set of self-reported and proxy-reported measures of physical, mental, and social health for adults and children living with a neurological condition.:An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

Concepts.longName: Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders
Concepts.definition: A set of self-reported and proxy-reported measures of physical, mental, and social health for adults and children living with a neurological condition.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
